Class BlockProtInventory

java.lang.Object
de.dei0.blockprot.bukkit.inventories.BlockProtInventory
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlockInfoInventory, BlockInspectContentsInventory, BlockLockInventory, FriendDetailInventory, FriendManageInventory, FriendSearchHistoryInventory, FriendSearchResultInventory, RedstoneSettingsInventory, StatisticListInventory, StatisticsInventory, UserSettingsInventory
public abstract class BlockProtInventory extends Object implements org.bukkit.inventory.InventoryHolder
A base inventory holder for each of the plugins inventories.
Since:
0.2.2

  • Constructor Details

    • BlockProtInventory

      @Deprecated public BlockProtInventory()
      Deprecated.
      Creates a new inventory using createInventory(). To avoid having the inventory created unconditionally, use BlockProtInventory(boolean).
      Since:
      0.2.2

    • BlockProtInventory

      public BlockProtInventory(boolean createInventory)
      Creates a new BlockProtInventory object, that optionally also has its inventory initialized directly.
      Parameters:
      createInventory - Whether the inventory should be instantly created.
      Since:
      1.1.7

    • getInventory

      @NotNull public final @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory getInventory()
      Gets this holder's inventory. Does not create a new one.

      The inventory for this holder.

    • getSize

      abstract int getSize()
      Get the size of this inventory, which should be a multiple of 9 with a maximum value of 6 * 9.
      Returns:
      The size of this inventory.
      Since:

    • getTranslatedInventoryName

      @Nullable abstract @Nullable String getTranslatedInventoryName()
      Gets the translated name of this inventory, or an empty String if not translatable, by the default TranslationKey for this inventory holder.
      Returns:
      The translated inventory name, or an empty String.
      Since:
      0.2.2

    • getDefaultInventoryName

      @Nullable public final @Nullable String getDefaultInventoryName()
      Get the default inventory name.
      Returns:
      The translated inventory name, or this class's simple name if the translation was not found.
      Since:
      0.2.2

    • createInventory

      @NotNull protected final @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory createInventory()
      Create this current inventory. If getTranslatedInventoryName() returns an empty String, this class's simple name will be used. If it returns null, this uses the default 'Chest' title.
      Returns:
      The Bukkit Inventory.
      Since:
      0.2.2

    • createInventory

      @NotNull protected final @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory createInventory(@NotNull @NotNull String title)
      Creates a new inventory with given title.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the inventory. Should be already translated.
      Returns:
      The new Bukkit inventory.
      Since:
      1.0.4

      Modifies given friend for given action.
      Parameters:

    • modifyFriendsForAction

      Parameters:

    • applyChanges

      protected void applyChanges(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nullable @Nullable Function<BlockNBTHandler,de.dei0.blockprot.nbt.LockReturnValue> onBlockChanges, @Nullable @Nullable Consumer<PlayerSettingsHandler> onSettingsChanges)
      Creates a temporary BlockNBTHandler or PlayerSettingsHandler depending on InventoryState.friendSearchState,
      Parameters:
      player - The player we use to obtain the InventoryState for.
      onBlockChanges - A callback to easily modify a BlockNBTHandler. Can be null, if this path is not intended.
      onSettingsChanges - A callback to easily modify a PlayerSettingsHandler. Can be null, if this path is not intended.
      Since:
      0.4.7

    • findItemIndex

      protected int findItemIndex(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
      Finds the index inside of this inventory for given item.
      Parameters:
      item - The item to check for. Every item in this inventory will be checked against this using ItemStack.equals(Object)
      Returns:
      The index of the item inside the inventory. If not found, -1.
      Since:
      0.2.2

    • setItemStack

      public void setItemStack(int index, org.bukkit.Material material, TranslationKey key)
      Sets a ItemStack with the type [material] and the name translated by [key] at [index].
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item inside this inventory.
      material - The material of the item.
      key - The translation key to use to get the translated name for this item.
      Since:
      0.2.3

    • setItemStack

      public void setItemStack(int index, org.bukkit.Material material, TranslationKey key, List<String> lore)
      Sets a ItemStack with the type material and the name translated by text with lore at index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item inside this inventory.
      material - The material of the item.
      key - The translatable text to use.
      lore - The lore of item, where each entry in the list is one line.
      Since:
      0.2.3

    • setItemStack

      Sets a ItemStack with the type material and the name as text at index.

      index - The index of the item inside this inventory.
      material - The material of the item.
      text - The text or name of the item.
      Since:
      0.4.0

      Parameters:

    • setEnchantedItemStack

      public void setEnchantedItemStack(int index, org.bukkit.Material material, TranslationKey key, boolean value)
      Sets an enchanted item stack in this inventory at index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item in the inventory.
      material - The material of the item.
      key - The translation key for the display name of the item.
      value - Whether the enchantment should be added.
      Since:
      0.4.13
      See Also:

    • closeAndOpen

      protected void closeAndOpen(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.HumanEntity player, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.inventory.Inventory inventory)
      Closes the player's current inventory and then opens the new inventory. If inventory is null, we clear the inventory state.
      Parameters:
      player - The player to close and open the inventories.
      inventory - The inventory we want to open. If null, we don't open any new inventory.
      Since:
      0.4.2

    • getProperMaterial

      protected org.bukkit.Material getProperMaterial(org.bukkit.Material material)
      This gets the proper material for a block. For example, wall signs have a different material, but that material does not have its own item.
      Parameters:
      material - The material to fix.
      Returns:
      The fixed material usable for the item in the inventory.
      Since:
      0.4.2

    • getNbtHandlerOrNull

      @Nullable protected @Nullable BlockNBTHandler getNbtHandlerOrNull(@Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      This gets the NBT Handler for the block requested by the player. If a RuntimeException is triggered due to the block being invalid, possibly by another player breaking it, we return null, indicating the caller should close the inventory.
      Parameters:
      block - The block
      Returns:
      The nbt handler, or null, if none.

    • getFriendSupportingHandler

      @Nullable protected @Nullable FriendSupportingHandler<de.tr7zw.changeme.nbtapi.NBTCompound> getFriendSupportingHandler(@NotNull InventoryState.FriendSearchState state, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @Nullable @Nullable org.bukkit.block.Block block)
      Gets the handler for the block opened/edited by the player.
      Since:
      1.0.0

      @Deprecated protected org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack toggleEnchants(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack)
      Deprecated.
      Adds an enchantment to stack and then hides it from the player.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "enchant".
      Since:
      0.4.13

    • toggleEnchants

      @NotNull @Deprecated protected @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack toggleEnchants(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack, @Nullable @Nullable Boolean toggle)
      Deprecated.
      Adds an enchantment to stack and then hides it from the player.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "enchant".
      toggle - The value to toggle to. Can be null, to just switch its current value.
      Since:
      0.4.13

    • updateTitle

      protected void updateTitle(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.entity.Player player, @NotNull @NotNull String title)
      Updates the title of this inventory. As inventory titles cannot be updated directly, this instead re-creates and re-opens the inventory.
      Parameters:
      title - The new title of the inventory. Should already be translated.
      Since:
      1.0.4

    • setEnchantedOptionItemStack

      public void setEnchantedOptionItemStack(int index, org.bukkit.Material material, TranslationKey key, boolean value)
      Sets an enchanted version of the material into the index. Based on the value of value, the string returned for the translation key will be suffixed with an ": Enabled", or ": Disabled", as per the respective translation key for each.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the item in the inventory.
      material - The material of the item.
      key - The translation key for the display name of the item.
      value - Whether the option is enabled. Controls the suffix and if the item is enchanted.
      Since:
      1.1.8

    • toggleOption

      @NotNull protected @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack toggleOption(@NotNull @NotNull org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack stack, @Nullable @Nullable Boolean toggle)
      Toggles the option name, if it's found at the end of the display name, and the enchantment status of the given itemstack.
      Parameters:
      stack - The stack to "enchant" and change the name of.
      toggle - The value to toggle to. Can be null, to just switch its current value.
      Since:
      1.1.8
